Posts.Content: Via wrote: when they told me I had breast cancer immediately they tell you what you have to do. They really don’t give you time for physiological accept what is happening. The fear to know you have cancer is truly horrible. Then You go into surgery and in my case get a double mastectomy with reconstruction. You wake up in pain and then the journey beggings of pain and being so uncomfortable and like you lost your body. The doctor told me that I would lost all sensation on your breasts and the reality of mentally accepting it. Is truly a different and difficult thing that no one really talk to you about. Yes, there are support groups. But, what happens in the middle of the night? When your in pain and you feel you have lost control of your body completely. Your breast and cheats feel so uncomfortable and not YOU! You find yourself crying because just a few months ago i was normal and here I am with this situation that came out of nowhere. How do you deal with it? Your heart and life feel so sad. I am truly broke... my heart and my spirit feel broken and so sady at times. I know am not the only one. I known sadly that somewhere in the world there may be another woman feeling the same thing I am! Is just not fair we have to have cancer and go through all that is expected of us! Via Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Your not yourself Via alto

Posts.Content: May 18, 2019 12:25AM Via wrote: am so glad your also not in pain. We have suffered enough with the first one. This is my second day after surgery and just discomfort not pain! Thank Goodness! Hope you continue to recover as well as you are! Am so happy for you
Posts.Title: second surgery Via SimoneRC

Posts.Content: May 17, 2019 11:59PM Via wrote: how many surgery did you had? Mine surgeon want a 3rd surgery taken some fat from my belly to fill in the top of my chest. I feel like that is just way to much surgery. Did you all have this extra surgery?
Posts.Title: second surgery Via SimoneRC

Posts.Content: Via wrote: have to share this because it all can't be bad this. I had surgery yesterday and they took my expanders out and put in my implants. I was really mess up the night before crying because I didn't want more pain. The first surgery was extremely painful. That stayed with me. But, am so glad and happy to say that I am not in pain. I am uncountable but I can deal with that. I am taking pain medication but I believe I can stop taking them by tomorrow. I want to give myself time to make sure I don't need them and start Tylenol only. I don't want to make an error and get pain. But, there is a light and am seeing it! Via Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: second surgery Via SimoneRC

Posts.Content: Via wrote: They removed my expender and now I have my permanent implants. But, after the surgery I just feel like mentally I have walk through hell! I hate to use that word. But, you ladies understand me. When they told us we had Cancer a tsunami came into our life and truly destroyed our life. We as strong women that we are have dealt with the surgery, treatment, side effects of whatever treatments we need. Now that the tsunami has pass we are left with a mess to clean. I personally feel my mental health have gone through a very hard journey and somehow it is time to deal with it! Make myself feel safe again. I am cancer free now and now I have to move on with mylife. But, it can't never be the same. I have change in this months. I have also learned that things do happen to anyone including myself and there is this vulnerably in me. I don't know if many of you understand what am trying to say. But, this group has help me so much just when I think am walking alone many of you write letting me know you are in the same path as I am. I thank you all for that! Via Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Recovery from second surgery Via Via

Posts.Content: May 25, 2019 03:46AM Via wrote: you made an amazing point and I will take it into my life! I will not permit this to destroy my life. Thank you for saying that  Via
Posts.Title: Recovery from second surgery Via Via

Posts.Content: May 7, 2019 07:06AM Via wrote: am confused too because my mom surgeon did her biopsy. But you said he won’t so not sure why they send you that direction.
